intro: Eastwoodia, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, primarily native to East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. These plants are characterized by their evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. Eastwoodia species typically thrive in moist, well-drained soils and prefer partial to full shade. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded garden environments.
